```{r}
library(BarnebyLives)
```

\vspace{2cm} 

```{r user defined settings}
herbarium_code <- ''
project_code <- ''
```

```{r load data}
herbarium <- herbaria_info |> 
  dplyr::filter(Abbreviation == herbarium_code)

project <- project_examples |> 
  dplyr::filter(Project == project_code)

specimens <- shipping_examples |>
  dplyr::mutate(Coll = paste(Primary_Collector, Collection_number)) |>
  dplyr::select(Collection = Coll, Taxon = Full_name) 
```

Dear `r herbarium$Contact`,

\vspace{1cm} 

We at `r project$Organization` are transferring these materials to `r herbarium$Abbreviation` to serve as vouchers for the `r project$Name` native seed conservation and developement project. 

\vspace{1cm} 

This package contains the specimens noted on the following page, and labels for them in a manila envelope. Every specimen in here is intended to represent a single set. These materials were collected under the auspices of the US Department of Interiors Bureau of Land Management, unless noted otherwise.

\vspace{1cm} 

Thank you, we appreciate both your and your staffs assistance in this matter. Please do not hesitate to reach out to me with any questions. 

\vspace{2cm} 

\begin{wrapfigure}{r}{0.15\textwidth}
  \centering
    \includegraphics[width=0.15\textwidth]{CBG-logo.png}
\end{wrapfigure}

Sincerely,

\vspace{0.5cm} 

`r project$Person`   

`r project$Phone`   

`r project$Email`

```{r Specimen table}
knitr::kable(specimens, longtable = T, booktabs = F) |>
  kableExtra::kable_styling(latex_options = c("hold_position", "repeat_header")) 
```

```{r clean environment}
rm(herbarium_code, project_code, herbarium, project, specimens)
```
